titleStmt.title: Playes confuted in fiue actions prouing that they are not to be suffred in a Christian common weale, by the waye both the cauils of Thomas Lodge, and the play of playes, written in their defence, and other obiections of players frendes, are truely set downe and directlye aunsweared. By Steph. Gosson, stud. Oxon.
titleStmt.author: Gosson, Stephen, 1554-1624.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A01951 of text S105757 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 12095). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 123 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 62 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

titleStmt.title: Playes confuted in fiue actions prouing that they are not to be suffred in a Christian common weale, by the waye both the cauils of Thomas Lodge, and the play of playes, written in their defence, and other obiections of players frendes, are truely set downe and directlye aunsweared. By Steph. Gosson, stud. Oxon.
titleStmt.author: Gosson, Stephen, 1554-1624.

publicationStmt.publisher: Imprinted for Thomas Gosson dwelling in Pater noster row at the signe of the Sunne,

notesStmt.note: In part a reply to "Protogenes can know Apelles by his line though he se him not" by Thomas Lodge; "The play of playes" is untraced.

keywords.term: Lodge, Thomas, 1558?-1625. -- Protogenes can know Apelles by his line though he se him not
